story.kicker_image_caption: File photo of Mohammad Amir in action. (Reuters Photo)
story.storykicker: Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir is set for a return to Test cricket after a five-year suspension for spot-fixing which ended in September last year.
story.storybody:
Pakistan paceman Mohammad Amir, who spent time in jail and served a five-year ban for spot-fixing, was named on Sunday in a 17-man squad for the test series in England starting next month.

Providing he is granted a visa to travel to Britain, the series will mark Amir's first test appearance since he was cleared to return to the sport last September.

Amir was rated among the world's most exciting fast bowlers before a 2010 spot-fixing scandal that resulted in bans and jail sentences for him, former test captain Salman Butt and fast bowler Mohammad Asif.

He has already toured New Zealand for a limited-overs series, played in the Asia Cup in Bangladesh and featured in the World Twenty20 in India since serving his ban.

Pakistan will play four tests, five one-dayers and a Twenty20 International in England between July 14 and Sept. 7.

Squad: Mohammad Hafeez, Shan Masood, Sami Aslam, Misbah-ul-Haq (captain), Younis Khan, Azhar Ali, Asad Shafiq, Iftikhar Ahmed, Sarfraz Ahmed (wicketkeeper), Mohammad Rizwan, Zulfiqar Babar, Yasir Shah, Wahab Riaz, Mohammad Amir, Rahat Ali, Imran Khan, Sohail Khan.
story.magazinekicker: Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir is set for a return to Test cricket after a five-year suspension for spot-fixing which ended in September last year.
story.shortheadline: Look who's back, Mohammad Amir picked for England Tests
story.storytitle: Mohammad Amir included in Pakistan squad for England Tests
story.longheadline: Mohammad Amir included in Pakistan squad for England Tests
story.strapheadline: Mohammad Amir's return to Test cricket will boost Pakistan's chances in England.

briefcase_content.briefcase: Mohammad Amir picked in Pakistan squad for four-Test series in England
Amir returns to Test cricket after serving out his five-year ban for spot-fixing
Pakistan's tour of England starts from July 14
